description: Evaluation questions for career advisor model with scoring criteria

questions.question: Should I accept a counteroffer from my current employer after getting an outside offer?

scoring_criteria.industry_accuracy: Reflects real data about counteroffer outcomes

expected_points: Most people who accept counteroffers leave within 6-12 months
You're now marked as a flight risk
Underlying issues don't disappear with more money

expected_points: Negotiate total compensation, not just base salary
Get competing offers for leverage
Never give a number first
Always counter the initial offer
RSUs and sign-on bonus often have more flexibility

questions.question: Should I join a FAANG company or a startup?
expected_points: FAANG: stability, brand name, clear leveling, liquid comp
Startup: potential upside requires evaluating stage/funding/equity
Most startup equity ends up worthless

expected_points: Get explicit feedback on what's missing
Understand if it's a you problem or a company problem
Sometimes the fastest promotion is at a new company

Your manager's advocacy matters more than your work

expected_points: Ask for fully diluted share count
Calculate your percentage ownership
Understand the strike price and 409A valuation
Most options end up worthless
Consider the vesting schedule and cliff
Factor in the company's funding stage and runway

questions.question: My manager is terrible but I like my team and work. Should I stay?

Your manager controls your reviews, promotions, and projects
Internal transfer might be an option
Document everything if it's truly bad
Don't sacrifice years waiting for them to leave

questions.question: I just got put on a PIP. What should I do?
